ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] analysing progress-statistics.log
ygData.msgSnippet: The queued URIs are almost certainly on some hosts that are not responding. Heritrix is trying them every 15 minutes, but then putting them back on the queue

The 'queued' URIs are almost certainly on some hosts that are not 
responding. Heritrix is trying them every 15 minutes, but then putting 
them back on the queue for another retry, until the default retry-count 
of 30 is reached.

Look at the 'frontier report' for more info on the queues affected. 
(Those in a slow retry due to a non-responsive server will usually show 
up as being 'snoozed' for periods of minutes rather than the usual 
number of seconds.)

The 'dumpPendingAtClose' frontier setting *should* cause all URIs not 
crawled to be dumped to the crawl.log if a crawl finishes cleanly with 
URIs left over. (Though, it hasn't been tested yet in H3.)

- Gordon @ IA

Pranay Pandey wrote:
> 
> 
> 
> Hi,
> 
> I had set up a crawl job to run for 6 hours using H3-beta. I had it 
> configured to be least polite and number of parallel queue was set to 5. 
> After completion, when I looked at the avg download rate (docs/sec), it 
> was 0.9 docs/sec. Some of the targeted contents were not archived.
> 
> Tracking down the reason for low download rate, I noticed that for 
> almost 4 out of 6 hours , the download rate was showing up 0. Here are 
> some of the lines of the progress-statistics.log files:
> 
> After an hour of start:
> 2009-10-27T23:41:21Z       18792        2697        15071        
> 3.5(3.85)   210(192)           133             2       134688        
> 217152            1        1019          17
> 
> After ~2 hours:
> 2009-10-28T00:44:41Z       21300         350        19849          
> 0(2.57)     0(135)           146             0       199768        
> 216896            1           0           2
> 
> At termination:
> 2009-10-28T04:36:01Z       21300         350        19849          
> 0(0.92)      0(48)           146             0       119000        
> 168896            1           0           2
> 
> As can been seen, for about 4 hours, the number of URIs queued up stayed 
> stagnant at 350. What could be causing this? Some of the contents well 
> within the scope were not crawled. Is there a way I can access the 
> 'queued' URIs?
> CandidateScoper.log and FrontierPreparer.log are empty.
> 
> Regards,
> Pranay
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
